main event: The report describes a sighting of a flashing red light and radar pips near Little Gull Point in Long Island Sound, New York.
interesting points: The object was reported by a ferry near Brooklyn, New York, approaching the shore at 300 degrees true and about 1 mile away.
Upon approaching the object, it disappeared visually and on radar. The ferry then conducted a search of the area, but the results were negative.
The report also mentions that the sighting was confirmed by a submarine using flashing lights and operations in the same location.
The incident was later evaluated as likely being two surfaced submarines, identified as the USS Blendy and USS Bang.
The report was part of the Project Blue Book investigation of unidentified flying objects.
sighted object: Flashing red light and radar pips
location: Little Gull Point, Long Island Sound, New York
